question: Does West Nile virus infection induce upregulation of mosGCTL-1 expression in mosquitoes compared with uninfected controls? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Following experimental West Nile virus infection, mosGCTL-1 transcripts rose significantly in mosquito midgut tissue within 24 hours post-exposure, as quantified by qRT-PCR, indicating infection-induced upregulation.
content.source_2: In vivo experiments show that mosGCTL-1 and mosPTP-1 function as part of the same pathway and are critical for WNV infection of mosquitoes.
content.source_3: Time-resolved transcriptomics of WNV-exposed mosquitoes revealed early induction of mosGCTL-1 coincident with viral entry and replication, with expression peaking between 12 and 18 hours post-blood meal, consistent with infection-triggered upregulation.
content.source_4: During the mosquito blood-feeding process, WNV infection was blocked in vivo with mosGCTL-1 antibodies.
